climbs.name: Sweet Suspicion
climbs.fa: Yerian, Caunt, Hill, Morris, Reyes July 1990

content.description: A thin crack start of the mid-cliff ledge leads up to horizontal seams taking you to the top. The crux comes near the top.
content.protection: Tiny to 1.5 inch. Small tri-cams are useful.
content.location: Sweet Suspicion is the crack immediate right of the Demonology dihedral.

content.description: Unrelenting steep chimney in the back of the Alcove on the Demonology Cliff. Right-side in.
content.protection: Regular rack. Does not require big cams.
content.location: Obvious chimney between the "Hidden Technology" tips crack and the "Hidden Technology" under-cling on the outside of the Alcove.

content.description: A 5.8 hand crack leads up through some small pine trees to the main ledge bisecting cliff at half-height. From here a difficult lie-back move (5.10b) gets you into a perfect straight-in hands crack leading to the top of the cliff. One of the best cracks here. Can be TRed or led.
content.protection: Regular rack. Build natural anchors on top with bomber medium pro.
content.location: From the base of "Demonology" wander left across the base of the cliff until you encounter a crack leading all the way to the summit.

content.description: A2 aid line up the thin crack off the main ledge to the right of the Demonology dihedral. One move of easy 5th to get started nailing with blades.
content.location: Just right of the Demonology dihedral off the main ledge.

content.description: Straight-in thin crack with the crux about half way up. Slammer hands at the top.
content.location: This is the first thin crack you will encounter when descending down and left to the base of "Demonology" (5.10b).

content.description: Thin crack leading up to a right-leaning tips lie-back.
content.protection: Regular rack with emphasis on thin wires. Double bolts in alcove on top.
content.location: First crack route on the far left side of the Demonology Cliff.

content.description: The gently overhanging thin crack crux begins off the ledge about half way up the cliff. Good locks lead up to a left-facing dihedral finish.
content.protection: Regular rack with an emphasis on thin gear.
content.location: Thin crack immediately right of "Old Fart On Crack" (5.11c/d)

content.description: Lie-back "ear" that can either be done as a 10b off-width or more easily lie-backed at 10a.
content.protection: Regular rack. Large cams helpful behind the "ear".
content.location: First climb to the left of "One Crack Below".

content.protection: thin wired to a few medium at the top
content.location: Straight-in thin crack in the "Alcove" between the "Hostile Witness" 'ear' and the "Side Effects" chimney.

content.description: Under-cling to a committing high step up an arete.
content.location: On the outside edge of an steep arete that forms the left (east) edge of the Alcove.

content.description: Starts off the ledge half-way up the cliff and goes up the same thin crack as "Sweet Suspicion" (5.11a), then branches up and left across the face (5.10d) to finish on top.
content.protection: tiny to 1-inch. Fixed pin needs testing.
content.location: This is the face immediately left of "Sweet Suspicion". Rap in to the ledge and belay from there.

content.description: The lie-back crux comes at the bottom of the obvious right-facing dihedral that begins from the ledge that bisects the cliff band half-way up. You can either begin from the bottom and climb up to this ledge via a 5.7 lie-back crack or rap into the ledge from above.
content.protection: Pro: Tiny to 1". Double-bolt anchors at the lip on top.
content.location: Obvious right-facing dihedral between "Sweet Suspicion" (5.11a) and "Quick and Dirty" (A2).

content.description: Left-leaning thin lie-back off the main ledge half way up the Demonology Cliff.
content.protection: Regular rack with emphasis on small to medium pieces.
content.location: Rap down onto the main ledge running across the whole cliff at half-height and climb the obvious lie-back to the top.
